funder.name: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada

abstract: <jats:p>The 16 world species of <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic> Latreille are revised, including seven previously undescribed species (<jats:italic>S.cryptica</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>S.hoguei</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>S.interrupta</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>S.oraria</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>S.pseudosphecomima</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>S.sexfasciata</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>S.weismani</jats:italic> Moran, <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>). Descriptions, redescriptions, male genitalia photographs, distribution maps, and an illustrated key for all <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic> are presented. DNA barcode data are provided for all 16 species with a cytochrome oxidase subunit I gene tree presented and discussed. <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic><jats:bold>stat. rev.</jats:bold> is redefined to represent the monophyletic lineage of species within subtribe Criorhinina possessing a bare, medial vitta extending ventrally from the oral margin in both sexes, a bare gena, a bare katepimeron, a scutellum with at least anterior margin densely pruinose, an anterior ventral half of vein C before crossvein h without setae, and a narrow intersection of vein R<jats:sub>1</jats:sub> with vein C. Three species groups of <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic> are identified: the <jats:italic>S.vittata</jats:italic> group which possess pruinose scutellar vittae, the <jats:italic>S.pattonii</jats:italic> group which lack pruinose scutellar vittae, and <jats:italic>S.metallica</jats:italic> (Bigot), a hairy bee mimic with a completely pruinose scutum. <jats:italic>Criorhinatsherepanovi</jats:italic> Violovitsh is resurrected and transferred, along with <jats:italic>Criorhinaaino</jats:italic> Stackelberg, to the genus <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic>: <jats:italic>S.tsherepanovi</jats:italic> (Violovitsh), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold> and <jats:italic>S.aino</jats:italic> (Stackelberg), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold><jats:italic>Criorhinametallica</jats:italic> (Bigot) is designated as the senior synonym of <jats:italic>C.lupina</jats:italic> (Williston), not junior as improperly treated, and transferred to <jats:italic>Sphecomyia</jats:italic>: <jats:italic>S.metallica</jats:italic> (Bigot), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold> The species <jats:italic>Sphecomyiafusca</jats:italic> Weisman, <jats:italic>S.nasica</jats:italic> Osburn, and <jats:italic>S.occidentalis</jats:italic> Osburn are transferred to <jats:italic>Criorhina</jats:italic> Meigen: <jats:italic>C.fusca</jats:italic> (Weisman), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>C.nasica</jats:italic> (Osburn), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>C.occidentalis</jats:italic> (Osburn), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
title: Revision of world Sphecomyia Latreille (Diptera, Syrphidae)
